title: Apple Becomes First Company to Reach $3.5 Trillion Market Cap
introText: Apple has achieved another historic milestone, becoming the first company to reach a $3.5 trillion market capitalization. The achievement comes as the company's services business and AI initiatives drive renewed investor optimism.

content.content: Apple's market cap crossed $3.5 trillion, extending its lead as the world's most valuable public company. The milestone reflects investor confidence in Apple's ability to maintain growth through new products and expanding services.
Shares have gained 45% in 2025, driven by strong iPhone sales, services growth, and AI feature announcements.

Apple's services business now generates $100 billion annually, with App Store, Apple Music, iCloud, and Apple TV+ all showing strong growth. The high-margin services segment has become increasingly important to Apple's profitability.
Advertising revenue from the App Store and News app has grown 50% year-over-year.
Apple Intelligence, the company's AI suite, has driven strong iPhone 16 upgrade rates. The Vision Pro 2 has exceeded sales expectations, establishing Apple in the spatial computing market.

summary: Apple becomes the first company to reach a $3.5 trillion market cap, driven by strong services growth and AI innovations.
